header_summary:
Gloria Zhao, fanquake, and Ava Chow have announced the availability of new release candidates for Bitcoin Core, versions 29.2rc2, 30.0rc3, and 28.3rc1, respectively. These updates signify progress towards the final versions, emphasizing the importance of community testing and feedback to ensure software stability and reliability. Detailed release notes and testing guides are accessible, highlighting the collaborative effort to refine Bitcoin Core across various development stages ([Bitcoin Core version 29.2rc2](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-29.2/test.rc2/), [version 30.0rc3](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-30.0/test.rc3), [version 28.3rc1](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-28.3/test.rc1/)).

Ilghan introduced the B-SSL system, aimed at enhancing Bitcoin security and management by addressing key loss in non-custodial wallets through a dual-component approach catering to both institutions and individual users. This innovative system promises to set a new standard in cryptocurrency storage and transactions, focusing on user control and institutional efficiency ([B-SSL system](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/concept-review-b-ssl-bitcoin-secure-signing-layer-covenant-free-vault-model-using-taproot-csv-and-cltv/2047/3)).

ZmnSCPxj and micah541 delve into technical and theoretical discussions, respectively. ZmnSCPxj explores the combination of LUKSv2 with dm-crypt and dm-integrity for data encryption and integrity verification, suggesting a move towards filesystems like ZFS to address the challenges of "log on a log" scenarios ([disk encryption and integrity](https://www.usenix.org/system/files/conference/inflow14/inflow14-yang.pdf)). Meanwhile, micah541 discusses Bitcoin's position as a potential Schelling point in financial systems, examining the paradox of power, coordination, and the impact of monopolistic control attempts on Bitcoin's stability and security ([Bitcoin Schelling point](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/a-game-theoretic-approach-to-bitcoin-s-valuation-in-equilibrium/1547/9)).

recent_posts.title: Concept Review: B-SSL (Bitcoin Secure Signing Layer) — Covenant-Free Vault Model Using Taproot, CSV, and CLTV
recent_posts.summary:
- B-SSL aims to improve Bitcoin security by addressing key loss in non-custodial wallets.
- It encompasses mint-005 for joint custody and a vault system for individual control.
- The system promises enhanced safety and usability for various cryptocurrency stakeholders.

recent_posts.title: Persisting Mutable Storage Inside The "T"EE
recent_posts.summary:
- LUKSv2's integration of dm-crypt and dm-integrity offers an encrypted data integrity verification akin to AE.
- ZFS reduces the "log-on-a-log" issue by merging atomicity, encryption, and logging into a unified layer.
- Addressing key deletion risks in statechain signers requires minimal journal use and controlled data erasure.

recent_posts.title: A Game-Theoretic Approach to Bitcoin’s Valuation in Equilibrium
recent_posts.summary:
- The debate assesses Bitcoin's role as a potent Schelling point, highlighting a paradox in its universal adoption.
- Concerns about monopolization arise, suggesting a quick resolution in power struggles through "hash wars."- Bitcoin’s security and viability hinge on its potential failure, influencing its stability as a global financial standard.

authors: [BIP Proposal] Limit ScriptPubkey Size >= 520 Bytes Consensus PortlandHODL
active_posts.summary:
- Brandon Black proposes a Bitcoin soft fork to limit ScriptPubkey size for security reasons.
- The rule affects a small fraction of outpoints, aiming to improve scalability and performance.
- The proposal also anticipates challenges but invites community feedback for balanced innovation.

active_posts.title: On (in)ability to embed data into Schnorr
authors: On (in)ability to embed data into Schnorr waxwing/ AdamISZ
active_posts.summary:
- AdamISZ explores embedding data in Schnorr signatures' tuples, questioning the security without revealing private keys.
- Concluding data embedding compromises private key secrecy, challenging the security of blockchain UTXO sets.
- Invites critique on his findings, directing readers to his research on GitHub for further discussion.

active_posts.title: Sharing block templates
active_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin nodes and miners have adopted new mempool policies, including full RBF and spam filters.
- Compact block relay significantly reduces block propagation times, enhancing network efficiency.
- Solutions like weak blocks and template sharing improve network robustness and transaction privacy.

active_posts.title: Response to Pieter Wuille's StackExchange Answer Re: Nuking the Opreturn Filter
active_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin's fee estimation process is complex and uncertain due to unpredictable miner actions.
- Efforts to standardize mempools for predictable fee estimation could undermine Bitcoin's decentralization.
- The focus should shift to broader network heuristics, embracing inherent transaction uncertainties and variabilities.

active_posts.title: Eclipsing Bitcoin Nodes with BGP Interception Attacks
active_posts.summary:
- The study exposes Bitcoin network vulnerabilities, showing eclipse attacks via BGP hijacking are feasible.
- Attackers manipulate BGP routes to control Bitcoin traffic, enabling potential financial abuses.
- Proposed mitigations include peer rotation, dynamic port negotiation, and route-aware peer selection in Bitcoin Core.
